intro: Senecio neelgherryanus, commonly known as the Neelgherryan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and it is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its region.
